title: ['Red Gate Fire Road', 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road']
description: ['Closed to vehicular traffic.', 'Closed to vehicular traffic.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Red Gate Fire Road', 'id': 'B7AF53DA-FA44-4743-B579-FF81CB68EE33', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/shen/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road', 'id': 'C509E46A-FE91-4AE4-9D13-9ECFEFC2F89D', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/shen/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
title: ['Visitor Center Parking Lot Closures August 5-19 -- No Oversized Vehicle Parking', 'South Rim Road Construction - Expect Delays & Parking Lot Closures', 'Road Construction at Black Canyon South Rim - 2024 and 2025']
description: ['Road construction at the South Rim Visitor Center parking lot from August 5-19. Oversized vehicles (trailers, RVs, buses) are PROHIBITED from entering the parking lot. Parking is very limited--do not park at the visitor center to hike. Plan ahead.', 'Gravel road surfaces and alternating one-way traffic (expect 15-minute delays and multiple stops) from the park entrance to the visitor center. Tomichi Point CLOSED July 30-31 and August 12-14. Plan ahead for VERY LIMITED PARKING.', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.']

title: ['Seasonal Canyon Closures']
description: ['The following are closed to the public through 8/31/2024 to protect sensitive resources: the heads of Burro Wash & Fivemile Wash continuing east 2 miles, Shinob Canyon and any route descending into Shinob, including Na-gah, Nighthawk, & Timpie.']

title: ['Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]
description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable."]

title: ['Parking Lot and Surrounding Area Closed for Construction August 12 through September 18.']
description: ["The Park's parking lot, access road, and outdoor classroom will be closed due to construction safety. Visitors can access the Visitor Center via walking the trails through Riverview Point Preserve located next door."]

title: ['Cades Cove closed Wednesdays to motor vehicles', 'Most visitors need a parking tag', 'Trail Advisory']
description: ['Cades Cove Loop Road is motor vehicle-free all day on Wednesdays from May through September to provide opportunities for cyclists and pedestrians to experience Cades Cove without motor vehicles.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).', 'Several trails in the park are temporarily closed. Please check the "Trail and Backcountry Closures, Warnings & Cautions" section of the Current Road, Facility, Trail & Backcountry Updates page for further details.']

title: ['Extreme Summer Heat can be Fatal', 'Hart Mine Road Closed due to dangerous potential for collapse', 'Cima Road between Cima and Interstate 15 CLOSED Until Early August 2024', 'Ivanpah Road Repairs - Traffic Subject to minor delays']
description: ['Summer temps in the preserve can exceed 120 degrees. Hiking in the middle of the day and or dealing with a vehicle breakdown on a remote road can quickly become a life-threatening emergency. Plan and prepare with water, shade, and stay with your vehicle.', 'Hart Mine Road is missing several wooden culverts the burned in the 2023 York Fire. The road may appear intact but could cave in under the weight of a vehicle. Stay off of Hart Mine Road for your safety.', 'Cima Road between Kelso Cima Road in Cima and Interstate 15 along the north preserve boundary is CLOSED to all vehicles. Please do not drive around barricades, or cross this active construction zone in the Cima Dome area.', 'Mojave National Preserve Road Crews will be repairing a problematic low water crossing ~2 miles north of the Junction of Cedar Canyon Road. Minor Delays are expected.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[], [{'title': 'Hart Mine Road', 'id': '09EAF34E-7380-4129-A04E-4F3AF013E1BD', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Cima Road Closed to ALL VEHICLES due to Construction', 'id': '734DA552-488D-4A3F-979D-751E95AB05CA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Ivanpah Low Water Crossing Repair', 'id': 'DEC80F3F-5E36-4E09-9DA3-1B74F93163D1', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['MP 292 - MP 305 Road Construction', 'MP 276.5 - MP 282 Road Construction', 'MP 261 - MP 276.5 Road Construction', 'MP 238.5 - MP 248 Road Construction', 'MP 229.5 - MP 238.5 Road Construction', 'MP 248 - MP 249 Bridge Construction', 'MP 221.8 - MP 229.5 Bridge Construction', 'MP 64.6 - MP 86.2 Pavement Preservation', 'MP 27.3 - MP 37.6 Pavement Preservation']
description: ['Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant is available via NC 18.', 'Road closed to all activity for repaving and infrastructure repair. Detour in place via NC 18 to the NC/VA line near milepost 217.3. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant, is available via NC 18.', 'Road closed to all activity for Laurel Fork Bridge replacement. Detour in place from MP 248 (NC 18) to MP 249 (Northwest Trading Post).', 'Road closed to all activity for replacement of 3 bridges. Detour in place via NC 18 to the NC/VA line near milepost 217.3. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant, is available via NC 18.', 'Single lane closure possible with reduced speed for paving work. Bicyclists and motorcyclists are advised to find alternative routes while pavement is curing due to hazardous conditions from loose gravel.', 'Single lane closure possible with reduced speed for paving work. Bicyclists and motorcyclists are advised to find alternative routes while pavement is curing due to hazardous conditions from loose gravel.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'MP 292 - MP 305 Road Construction', 'id': '91C85167-D35D-491B-AA25-5C0126ABCB3A', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 276.5 - MP 282 Road Construction', 'id': 'D0E50AD5-402C-449A-851F-72942841B9F8', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 261 - MP 276.5 Road Construction', 'id': '6D508046-E8DA-4DA2-9D1C-1F51604B974F', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 238.5 - MP 248 Road Construction', 'id': '9C351538-9DC3-4586-8B55-2F592C9D3AB8', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 229.5 - MP 238.5 Road Construction', 'id': 'F0074D0C-85BC-4CE1-9661-CADF62BB4AA5', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 248 - MP 249 Bridge Construction', 'id': 'AB5E8A6A-055C-4A2C-A11F-89B06AB41160', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 221.8 - MP 229.5 Bridge Construction', 'id': 'E185319B-0775-4E70-871E-BE6E3765BB13', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 64.6 - MP 86.2 Pavement Preservation', 'id': 'F7326A8B-AF2E-4723-A0C6-B30424A3FBD9', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 27.3 - MP 37.6 Pavement Preservation', 'id': '13D7EE8B-47E6-4594-8012-B08DEDCBD862', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']
description: ['The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']

title: ['Steel Creek Road Intermittent Closure', 'South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Parking is not permitted on the Kyles Landing Road (County Road 56)', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']
description: ['Starting July 29th, Steel Creek Road will be shut down Monday through Thursday from 8am-4:30pm. Access to the river and campground areas will be available outside of closure times and any time on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.', 'In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Steel Creek Road - Intermittent Closure', 'id': '57069059-5F20-4F0C-8D47-36EF893B4AE5', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/buff/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'South Woolum Road Closure', 'id': '83A17F44-C295-4B5D-82F4-C770BDB1CD1A', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/buff/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [], []]

title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']
description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']

title: ['East Rim Drive CLOSED from Skell Head to Phantom Ship Overlook for Road Construction', 'Mount Scott Trail is Currently CLOSED Due to Unsafe Conditions']
description: ['Due to a major road construction project, the road from Skell Head to Phantom Ship Overlook is CLOSED to ALL travel, along with Cloudcap Road. This is the second year of a 5 year project to rehabilitate East Rim Drive and repair historic rock walls.', 'Major road construction on the East Rim Drive near Mount Scott makes it unsafe to hike or bike to the trailhead on the closed road. Once construction moves beyond that area later in the summer, the trailhead will reopen.']

title: ['Road Maintnence on Highway 47A']
description: ['Road maintenance is taking place on Highway 47A in front of the overlook and trailhead entrance. The road is open but vehicles may come into contact with oil.']

title: ['Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage']
description: ['Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.']

title: ['Fire Restrictions in Place - NO Smoking']
description: ['Fire restrictions are in place at Tuzigoot National Monument. Smoking is prohibited, including Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (E.N.D.S.), except when inside a personal vehicle.']

title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']
description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may drive but not stop or exit their vehicle in this area.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']

title: ['Hart Mine Road CLOSED due to collapsed culverts', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely', 'Use Caution on Roads with Debris']
description: ['Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.', 'Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.']

title: ['Trail Closure']
description: ['Wilderness Road is closed from Tennessee Road Trail to the trail that leads up to Gap Cave for scheduled maintenance work.']

title: ['South Cut trail Partially Closed']
description: ['South Cut Trail is closed between the main road and Killman Field trail due to washout along the trail. Detour for that section is along Killman Field trail. South Cut trail from Killman Field trail to the beach is open.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Construction']
description: ['Partial closure of Education Center parking lot due to ongoing construction. No capacity for oversized vehicles (busses, trucks with trailer/camper, long RVs). Please use Heritage Center and Freeman School lots.']

title: ['National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians', 'Louisiana Circle Closed', "North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle Closed"]
description: ['Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.', 'Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.', "Due to weather related incidents, North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle are closed to vehicular and recreational traffic. Entering these areas is prohibited. A portion of Grant Avenue is open for touring."]

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Your GPS May Be Wrong']
description: ['There are five entrances to the park. GPS may take you to the wrong entrance or attempt to follow the most direct route, which could lead to closed gates. It can take hours to reroute to the correct entrance. Check directions & maps, not just your GPS.']

title: ['Fire Ban in Effect']
description: ['Fire Ban in Effect as of July 24th, 2024, at 2 PM. No open fires with wood/charcoal are permitted in the park. Gas/Propane stoves are permitted. Smoking allowed only in Vehicles or Paved Parking Lots. No Fireworks Allowed at all times. 36 CFR 1.5(a)(1).']

title: ['Road Closures in Culp’s Hill & Spangler’s Spring Area Begin July 29 for Paving Project']
description: ['Road closures will temporarily interrupt the ability to visit portions of the battlefield while work is ongoing. A mix of daytime and nighttime work will occur. Park roads may be fully closed, intermittently closed, or reduced to a single lane of traffic.']

Park Full Name: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park
title: ['Overlook Parking Lot Unavailable After Dark', 'Heavy Construction Vehicle Operations & Limited Amphitheater Accessibility']
description: ["The park parking lot at 72 McBride Extension is open from dawn to dusk every day. Any vehicles left in the parking lot after dusk (i.e. sunset) are subject to towing at owner's expense.", 'Heavy construction vehicles are operating through the parking lot & Lower Overlook Park - use caution & be vigilant for hazards. Lower Overlook & Amphitheater access is via stairs only for construction duration.']

title: ['If you have been redirected from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route']
description: ["You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011."]

title: ['Road Construction Delays April 1 to Mid-August 2024']
description: ['Road construction in the park from April 1 to mid-August 2024. Weekly updates on construction activities and locations in the park will be posted on the Bighorn Canyon Facebook page. Visitors can also call 307-548-5406 for current conditions.']

Park Full Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site
title: ['Pedestrian Bridge at Front Lake is Closed']
description: ['The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. A 6-passenger accessible shuttle runs daily every 20 minutes from 9:40 am to 4:20 pm, from the main parking lot, on Little River Road, to the Sandburg Home and farm area.']

Park Full Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument
title: ['Painted Hills- Large RV or Travel Trailer not Recommended Beyond Overlook Trail']
description: ['Don’t get your vehicle stuck at the Painted Hills! We want you and your RV or large bus to enjoy your trip. Travel trailers or large buses are not recommended beyond the Overlook Trail at Painted Hills due to limited turning radius.']

title: ['Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians']
description: ['Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.']

title: ['Hurricane Ridge will close Sunday, 8/4, from 7 AM to 12 PM', 'Queets River Road Closed']
description: ['For the Annual "Ride the Hurricane" event, Hurricane Ridge Road will be closed to all traffic. The road will reopen when the event has concluded.', 'The Queets River Road is closed for culvert repairs at the Hartzell Boat Launch. As of 7/30, eight out of fifteen culvert repairs are complete. The boat launch will remain open during the road closure.']

Park Full Name: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine
title: ['Motorized Recreational Scooters Not Permitted in Park']
description: ['For the safety and protection of visitors and park resources, motorized scooters are not permitted within the park. Any vehicles (scooters, bicycles, etc.) that are part of a ride-share program may not be left behind for pick up inside the park']

title: ["Bandelier's Mandatory Shuttle Runs June 27-October 16, 2024", 'The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended']
description: ['Bandelier’s mandatory shuttle service begins on June 27 and will run to October 16. Visitors may drive their private vehicles directly to the Bandelier Visitor Center before 9 am or after 3 pm.', 'Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

title: ['Temporary Road Closures and Fire Restrictions']
description: ['Hilina Pali Road at the Mauna Iki Trail and Mauna Loa Road at Kīpukapuaulu Trailhead will be closed to vehicle use due to increased fire danger. Backcountry hikers will be provided access. All campfires and open flame cooking fires is prohibited.']

title: ['Denali Park Road Information', 'Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide']
description: ['The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 15 (Savage River) for personal vehicles. Vehicle travel beyond Savage River in summer is mainly limited to transit and tour buses.', 'Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.']

title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']
description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']

title: ['The Green River Ferry Is Open to Vehicles but Closed to RVs and Trailers', 'Green River Ferry Status']
description: ['The Green River Ferry is open to vehicle traffic but is closed to trailers and recreational vehicles due to low water conditions. The closure will last until the river depth increases to safe levels to transport vehicles.', 'The Green River Ferry Status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at (270) 758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter feed. 2 vehicle limit.']

title: ['CENTRAL VA – PARKING LOT CLOSURE– ROUTE 311/MCAFEE KNOB']
description: ['McAfee Knob/Route 311 parking area along the A.T. in Catawba will be closed Thursday, November 30. The lot is being closed to allow for the construction of a new pedestrian footbridge over Route 311.']

title: ['State Route 20 Travel Status', 'Cascade River Road Closure', 'Hozomeen Gate Will Remain Closed', 'Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20']
description: ['Monitor the WSDOT real time travel map for up-to-date information on State Route 20 alerts and travel status.', 'Cascade River Road is closed at MP 8 (Marble Creek) due to the Pincer Two Fire. There is no access to the park beyond the closure.', 'The gate at Hozomeen will remain closed to vehicle access from Canada. Winnebago Flats and the upper Hozomeen campgrounds will remain closed. For more information visit the news release on summer operations.', 'Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.']

title: ['Fire Restrictions in Place - NO Smoking']
description: ['Fire restrictions are in place at Montezuma Castle National Monument and its Sub-Unit Montezuma Well. Smoking is prohibited, including Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (E.N.D.S.), except when inside a personal vehicle.']

title: ['Flooding on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek']
description: ['Increased rain and beaver dam activity this year flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail. Please use caution as you pass through the water. Park staff is in the process of determining a drier route.']

Park Full Name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area
title: ['Old Mine Road South Closed for Rehabilitation Project', 'Dingmans Falls Visitor Center is Closed to RVs, Buses, and Trailers on Weekends and Holidays.']
description: ['Old Mine Road between Millbrook Village and Worthington State Forest is closed for a pavement rehabilitation project. No pedestrian, bicycle, or vehicle traffic is permitted in the closed area. Please see news releases for more information.', 'Due to the heavy volume of traffic and long wait times, the access road to Dingmans Falls Visitor Center is closed to recreational vehicles, buses, and trailers on both weekends and holidays.']

title: ['Highway Construction Impacting Travel to the Memorial']
description: ['Numerous highway construction projects are occurring in the Black Hills and may impact trip planning to the Memorial. Please consult with South Dakota 511 to minimize delays or other inconveniences.']

title: ['Some Streets in Downtown Bar Harbor Closed for Construction Through Summer', 'Great Meadow Loop Trail closed along Great Meadow Drive']
description: ['To avoid traffic congestion, visitors should access Sand Beach via the Park Loop Road by following signs from the park’s Hulls Cove entrance on Route 3 (Eden Street) or Cadillac Mountain entrance on Route 233 (Eagle Lake Road) in Bar Harbor.', 'The trail crew will be removing old road asphalt with heavy equipment to restore the area to a more natural state. Hikers will be able to walk along the roadway of Great Meadow Drive to access trails into Sieur de Monts area.']

title: ['2024 Off Road Vehicle Closure Order']
description: ['All Off-Road Vehicle Trails will be temporarily closed for recreational access from Monday, June 3rd until Friday, August 2nd. Please click the link to view the official closure order.']

title: ['Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2024']
description: ['Reds Meadow Road & shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, will be closed for construction from Sundays at 11 pm through Fridays at 9 am (except holidays) during the summer 2024 season. The road also closes Fridays starting September 15.']

title: ['Going-to-the-Sun Road Opens for the Season']
description: ['The Going-to-the-Sun Road is fully open for the 2024 summer season. The road may now be accessed by motorized vehicles over Logan Pass from both the West Glacier and St. Mary entrances.']

title: ['Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended']
description: ['Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.']

title: ['Grand View Point closing for construction weekdays August through September', 'Seasonal climbing closures in effect', 'Expect long lines to enter the park']
description: ['Grand View Point Overlook, Grand View Point Trail, and 0.3 mi (0.5 km) of park road will close 6 am Mondays to 4 pm Thursdays for a total of eight weeks. The closure applies to all uses, including vehicles, tour buses, motorcycles, bikes, & hikers.', 'All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1, March 15, or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.', 'Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.']

Park Full Name: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area
title: ['Temporary Trail Closure During Ongoing Storm Recovery']
description: ['NPS work crews continue their work to clear roads and trails of numerous hazardous trees from the weather event on May 26. Due to safety concerns, numerous trails are temporarily closed to pedestrian, bike, and horse traffic due to extensive tree damage.']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']
description: ['The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.']

title: ['Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.']
description: ['Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4']

title: ['Crater Road and Summit District Access Closed', 'Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway']
description: ['Crater Road is reclosed by Maui County for continued firefighting. During the closure there is no access to Summit District including Hosmer Grove and Haleakalā Crater. Kīpahulu District is open as usual. For road closure information: www.mauicounty.gov', 'Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.']

title: ['Emergency Closure Due to Fire']
description: ['Highway 89 through the park is closed to the public due to the Park Fire and is only open as an evacuation route. Recreation is prohibited in the park due to extreme fire danger.']

title: ['Old Nashville Highway Repaving May Cause Delays and Temporary Closure of Park Sites July 31, 2024']
description: ['Starting on July 31, 2024, expect delays of up to 15 minutes when exiting the park through our visitor center gate. Access to the tour road at Van Cleve Lane, Stones River National Cemetery and the Hazen Brigade Monument at Tour Stop 5 may be blocked.']

Park Full Name: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site
title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]

Park Full Name: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve
title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.']

title: ['Landing at Hwy 137']
description: ['The highway 137 bridge landing sustained flood damage in 2019 and the landing restoration by NDOT has been completed. The area is smaller than in the past and the access to the water is steeper. Use caution when accessing the landing']

title: ['South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28']
description: ['Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.']

title: ['Main Park Roads Open to Vehicular Traffic Starting March 10', 'County road through the Fort Heiman Unit is Closed to Vehicles Past the Pavilion']
description: ['Beginning Sunday, March 10th, 2024, main park roads will be open to vehicular traffic from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.', 'Fort Heiman is located at 682 Fort Heiman Road, New Concord KY. Due to poor conditions of county roads, the County has posted the loop road closed to vehicles past the park pavilion. Pedestrian access is permitted.']

Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']

title: ['County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']
description: ['County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']

title: ['Road Damage']
description: ['Due to damage from heavy rains, some roads may require high clearance or 4x4 vehicles for passage. Please use caution when approaching and driving on roadways. Trailers over 30 ft not advised.']

title: ['Road repairs may occur 4/29 to 8/1; brief delays & some closures expected', 'Seasonal climbing closures in effect']
description: ["Crews will perform crack sealing and similar minor repairs on Arches' paved park road this summer. Visitors may encounter brief delays and reduced availability in or limited closures of some parking lots.", 'All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1 or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.']

title: ['Trail Conditions']
description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']

title: ['Notice to travelers to National Cemetery']
description: ['Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]

Park Full Name: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site
title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']

title: ['Road Closure: Marshall Hall Access Road']
description: ['The Marshall Hall Access Road is closed due to construction. This road connects the Marshall Hall ruins to Marshall Hall Rd. The main road remains open.']

title: ['Minute Man Visitor Center Open Wednesdays- Fridays 9:00 am - 12:00 pm', 'Trail Closures on Battle Road Trail', 'Trail Closures in place to allow for trail improvements']
description: ['Minute Man Visitor Center is open Wednesday, Thursdays and Fridays from 9:00 - 12:00 July 1- August 31, 2024. The last showing of the Road to Revolution is at 11:30 am.', 'Battle Road Trail between Olive Stow Boardwalk to Brooks Village is closed until mid-July 2024. This will allow for the completion of a trail re-route. Entering closures is prohibited. Please plan accordingly.', 'Rolling Trail Closures and Parking Lot Closures on Battle Road Trail and at the North Bridge Trail will occur in the spring, summer and fall of 2024. Entering closures is prohibited.']

title: ['Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway', 'Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail']
description: ['There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.', 'Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.']

title: ['Partial Closure of Little Calumet River Water Trail', 'Poor Trail Conditions on the Calumet Bike Trail']
description: ['Due to construction on Waverly Road Bridge, East Branch of Little Calumet River is currently closed to boating, swimming, floating, and paddling between Taylor Street Launch and Howe Road Launch.', 'The section of trail from the Dune Park Train Station to East State Park Road is in very poor condition with large, deep puddles of standing water and sections with larger gravel stones. Ride this section with extreme caution.']

title: ['Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about mobile devices and map/navigation apps', 'Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.']
description: ['Map apps may direct you to Parashant if you search for directions to "Grand Canyon" due the canyon\'s name in both the national park and monument names. The national park has paved roads and services. Parashant has no services and rugged/remote conditions.', 'Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.']

title: ['Click on "caution" alerts below for important details on accessing the park', "Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance", 'Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail']
description: ['Tamiami Trail and State Road 9336 both have ongoing construction which may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly.', 'Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.', "Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs."]

title: ['Towpath Trail Temporary Closure']
description: ['Towpath Trail will be closed for repairs starting at Station Road and extending 2,500 feet north from 7 a.m. and 5 p.m, weekdays. No detour is provided. The anticipated opening date is late January. Towpath will remain open southbound from Station Road.']

title: ['Visit Safely in the Summer', 'Highway Road Construction Outside Monument', 'Vehicle Length Limits']
description: ['Summer season brings hot temperatures and monsoons. Bring water, snacks, and sun protection for your visit. Check weather conditions before hiking. Severe lighting and flash floods can occur. When driving in the area, avoid flooded roadways.', 'There will be construction on the four-mile section of highway outside of the park entrance until August 19, 2024. There may be periods of brief delay when entering or exiting the park.', "Vehicles longer than 24 feet are not permitted past the visitor center on Bonita Canyon Drive. Vehicles up to 29 feet are still allowed to stay in the campground, but can't go further. Parking for large vehicles and trailers is available at Faraway Ranch."]

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins']
description: ["Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]

title: ['Road and Parking Lot Construction']
description: ['Cedar Breaks is undergoing a road preservation project this summer. From July - mid-August, be prepared for any potential delays, closures or noise along the main park road, parking lots, and campground.']

title: ['Biscuit Basin closed for the remainder of summer due to hydrothermal explosion', 'Vehicle Entrance Reservation Not Needed']
description: ['The parking lot and boardwalks at Biscuit Basin, located north of Old Faithful, are closed for the remainder of the summer due to a hydrothermal explosion that occurred July 23. The Grand Loop Road remains open to vehicles.', 'Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.']

title: ['Dangerous Highway Crossing']
description: ['Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.']

Park Full Name: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument
title: ['Impassable Washout on Sebeois Connector Road']
description: ['There is an impassable washout on the Seboeis Connector Road (46.07214,-68.63190) within the Seboeis Parcel of Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Road Work: Expect Delays on Park Roads', 'Camp only in campgrounds']
description: ['Zion will be patching asphalt on park roads starting on Monday, July 29, 2024. Some areas will be reduced to one-lane traffic. Waits along the Zion-Mt Carmel Highway should not exceed 20 minutes.', 'If you camp in a vehicle in an area that is not a designated campground, you may get a citation. Learn more about opportunities to camp in Zion.']

title: ['NPS 300 Road Conditions']
description: ['NPS 300 to Big Tubes is dry and mostly smooth with only a few short, rutted spots.\xa0 A four-wheel drive, high clearance vehicle is recommended.']

title: ['Partial Miles Creston Road Closure begins on July 10, 2024', 'Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area']
description: ['Lincoln County will be closing a portion of Miles Creston from Highway 2 to Copenhaver Road beginning July 10, 2024, through December 1, 2024. If you are accessing Lincoln Mill, Hawk Creek, or Seven Bays you may need to find an alternate route.', 'Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.']

title: ['Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic']
description: ['Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park', 'Parking & Shuttle Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.', 'Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.']

title: ['Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?']
description: ['Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended']

title: ['Service Road Closure']
description: ['The Service Road/Trail toward the lighthouse are closed to due scheduled construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.']

title: ['Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.']
description: ['The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.']

title: ['Infrastructure Projects to Cause Closures and Disruptions', 'Roadway Delays']
description: ['Visitors should expect disruptions to their experience at the park this year due to a number of major infrastructure projects involving intermittent closures to campgrounds, roads, and trailheads, For more information, click "More" or call 775-234-7331.', 'Expect up to 30min delays on roads in the park as sections of the road may have to be reduced to one lane.']

title: ['Secure trash and food']
description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']

title: ['Salmi Road Entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail out of the Kabetogama Community Remains Temporarily Closed.']
description: ["Salmi Road entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail remains temporarily closed at the trail's western most terminus. Access to the trail remains open at trailheads along Ash River Trail road, Meadwood Road, and the eastern terminus within the community of Ash River."]

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']

title: ['North Face Fire Update - 1230 on 7/29']
description: ['The park is open and regularly operating; tours and visitor services continue as normal. Do not fly drones in the park, and watch for fire personnel and vehicles. This alert will be updated as information is available.']

title: ['Partial closure of Drown Road (trail) at Fort Baker in June/July 2024', 'Phleger Estate Miramontes Trail Closed for Public Safety January 2022 Until Trail is Replaced', 'Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['Sections of Drown Road (trail) at Fort Baker will be closed intermittently in late June through July for the installation of telecom infrastructure. Please pay attention to signage around the closed areas.', 'Due to previous storm damage, the trail has been closed until the park can re-route it to a better location. Until construction of a re-route is complete, the trail will be closed.', 'You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Warning about GPS Systems!']
description: ['Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.']

title: ['RVs, Trailers and Other Oversized Vehicles (Limited Parking)']
description: ['Due to increased visitation, parking lots often fill up early. Visitors need to be aware that parking for larger vehicles is very limited. RVs using "tow dollies" may have to unhook towed vehicles in order to turn around in the parking lot on busy days.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['277N Campground Closed to Tentatively Reopen September 1']
description: ['Due to resource theft and damage from unauthorized off-road travel in and around the campground, the 277N Campground is closed. It is expected to reopen September 1, 2024.']

title: ['Main Road Status']
description: ['The main park road is fully open to Rainbow Point (Mile 18 of 18). All park roads are currently open for the season. During snowstorms the road may temporarily close at Mile 3 for snowplow operations.']

Park Full Name: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site
title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']
description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]

title: ['Park Road Closures beginning Thursday, July 11, 2024', 'Morristown road closures beginning 29 February', 'Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']
description: ['The Jockey Hollow tour road will be closed daily at 6:30pm, but grounds are open until 8pm. Fort Nonsense parking lot closes at 6pm, but grounds will remain open to pedestrians until 8pm. The NY Brigade and JH Visitor Center parking lots close at 8pm', 'On 2/29 Eastbound Morris St. will be closed down to one lane starting at Ridgedale Ave for about 140 days. Westbound Morris St will closed to all traffic starting at the intersection of Ford Ave and Taft Lane. Please plan alternate routes.', "Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

title: ['Cades Cove closed Wednesdays to motor vehicles', 'Most visitors need a parking tag', 'Trail Advisory']
description: ['Cades Cove Loop Road is motor vehicle-free all day on Wednesdays from May through September to provide opportunities for cyclists and pedestrians to experience Cades Cove without motor vehicles.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).', 'Several trails in the park are temporarily closed. Please check the "Trail and Backcountry Closures, Warnings & Cautions" section of the Current Road, Facility, Trail & Backcountry Updates page for further details.']

title: ['River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']
description: ['The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']

title: ['Steel Creek Road Intermittent Closure', 'South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Parking is not permitted on the Kyles Landing Road (County Road 56)', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']
description: ['Starting July 29th, Steel Creek Road will be shut down Monday through Thursday from 8am-4:30pm. Access to the river and campground areas will be available outside of closure times and any time on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.', 'In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Steel Creek Road - Intermittent Closure', 'id': '57069059-5F20-4F0C-8D47-36EF893B4AE5', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/buff/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'South Woolum Road Closure', 'id': '83A17F44-C295-4B5D-82F4-C770BDB1CD1A', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/buff/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [], []]

title: ['Seasonal Canyon Closures']
description: ['The following are closed to the public through 8/31/2024 to protect sensitive resources: the heads of Burro Wash & Fivemile Wash continuing east 2 miles, Shinob Canyon and any route descending into Shinob, including Na-gah, Nighthawk, & Timpie.']

title: ['Extreme Summer Heat can be Fatal', 'Hart Mine Road Closed due to dangerous potential for collapse', 'Cima Road between Cima and Interstate 15 CLOSED Until Early August 2024', 'Ivanpah Road Repairs - Traffic Subject to minor delays']
description: ['Summer temps in the preserve can exceed 120 degrees. Hiking in the middle of the day and or dealing with a vehicle breakdown on a remote road can quickly become a life-threatening emergency. Plan and prepare with water, shade, and stay with your vehicle.', 'Hart Mine Road is missing several wooden culverts the burned in the 2023 York Fire. The road may appear intact but could cave in under the weight of a vehicle. Stay off of Hart Mine Road for your safety.', 'Cima Road between Kelso Cima Road in Cima and Interstate 15 along the north preserve boundary is CLOSED to all vehicles. Please do not drive around barricades, or cross this active construction zone in the Cima Dome area.', 'Mojave National Preserve Road Crews will be repairing a problematic low water crossing ~2 miles north of the Junction of Cedar Canyon Road. Minor Delays are expected.']

Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
title: ['Visitor Center Parking Lot Closures August 5-19 -- No Oversized Vehicle Parking', 'South Rim Road Construction - Expect Delays & Parking Lot Closures', 'Road Construction at Black Canyon South Rim - 2024 and 2025']
description: ['Road construction at the South Rim Visitor Center parking lot from August 5-19. Oversized vehicles (trailers, RVs, buses) are PROHIBITED from entering the parking lot. Parking is very limited--do not park at the visitor center to hike. Plan ahead.', 'Gravel road surfaces and alternating one-way traffic (expect 15-minute delays and multiple stops) from the park entrance to the visitor center. Tomichi Point CLOSED July 30-31 and August 12-14. Plan ahead for VERY LIMITED PARKING.', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.']

title: ['Parking Lot and Surrounding Area Closed for Construction August 12 through September 18.']
description: ["The Park's parking lot, access road, and outdoor classroom will be closed due to construction safety. Visitors can access the Visitor Center via walking the trails through Riverview Point Preserve located next door."]

title: ['MP 292 - MP 305 Road Construction', 'MP 276.5 - MP 282 Road Construction', 'MP 261 - MP 276.5 Road Construction', 'MP 238.5 - MP 248 Road Construction', 'MP 229.5 - MP 238.5 Road Construction', 'MP 248 - MP 249 Bridge Construction', 'MP 221.8 - MP 229.5 Bridge Construction', 'MP 64.6 - MP 86.2 Pavement Preservation', 'MP 27.3 - MP 37.6 Pavement Preservation']
description: ['Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant is available via NC 18.', 'Road closed to all activity for repaving and infrastructure repair. Detour in place via NC 18 to the NC/VA line near milepost 217.3. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant, is available via NC 18.', 'Road closed to all activity for Laurel Fork Bridge replacement. Detour in place from MP 248 (NC 18) to MP 249 (Northwest Trading Post).', 'Road closed to all activity for replacement of 3 bridges. Detour in place via NC 18 to the NC/VA line near milepost 217.3. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant, is available via NC 18.', 'Single lane closure possible with reduced speed for paving work. Bicyclists and motorcyclists are advised to find alternative routes while pavement is curing due to hazardous conditions from loose gravel.', 'Single lane closure possible with reduced speed for paving work. Bicyclists and motorcyclists are advised to find alternative routes while pavement is curing due to hazardous conditions from loose gravel.']
